intro: Selago sandersonii, commonly known as the sanderson’s selago, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, oblong fruits. Selago sandersonii is often found in dune environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
